name: 'Y' Not Take This Quiz? | Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was the name of the instrumental theme of the TV series, 'The Benny Hill Show'?
He won an Oscar for his role in 1969's 'They Shoot Horses, Don't They?'. Who was the actor?
questions.explanation:
Gig Young.

	Gig's real name was Byron Barr and he was born on November 4, 1913. All of the other 'Young' choices are fine actors too.

questions.text: What male name means laughter in Hebrew?
questions.explanation:
Yitzhak.

	Yitzhak is a popular name for Israeli leaders. Yitzhak Shamir and Yitzhak Rabin come to mind.

questions.text: This baseball Hall of Famer was nicknamed, 'The Yankee Clipper'. Who was he?
questions.explanation:
Joe DiMaggio.

	Joe DiMaggio was so popular with his fans, that during World War II, Japanese soldiers resorted to insulting DiMaggio across battlefields in an attempt to upset American soldiers.

questions.text: The influential British group, The Yardbirds, took their name from a novel by which author?
questions.explanation:
Jack Kerouac.

	The term 'Yardbird' came from the designation given to hobos in one of Kerouac's novels.

questions.text: What actor's real name is Joe Yule Jr?
questions.explanation:
Mickey Rooney.

	A Brooklyn native, Rooney played Andy Hardy in the film series and starred in numerous other films.

questions.text: Yuengling is the name of the oldest brewery in the United States. Where is it located?
questions.explanation:
Pottsville, Pennsylvania.

	Founded in 1829, it is still located there.

questions.text: What is farmer Max Yasgur's claim to fame?
questions.correct: His land in Bethel, New York was where the Woodstock Festival was held
options: He led the authorities to Bonnie and Clyde
questions.explanation:
His land in Bethel, New York was where the Woodstock Festival was held.

	The rock festival was held on August 15-17, 1969.

questions.text: What English city was once an important Roman military post, an Anglo-Saxon capital, a Danish settlement and then the ecclesiastical centre of Northern England?
questions.explanation:
York.

	The Cathedral and Metropolitical Church of Saint Peter in York, or, the York Minster Cathedral, dates back to the thirteenth century.

questions.text: Yuri was the first name of the title character in which Russian novel?
questions.explanation:
Doctor Zhivago.

	The Pasternak novel "Doctor Zhivago" was made into a film in 1965 and starred Omar Sharif in the title role.
